title: Designated Asset vs. Wrong Substitute
vignette: An engineer sets aside a *specific* model of component for a regulatory safety test but accidentally processes the cheaper variant instead.

options.text: Invalidate the test and redo with the correct component.
Accept itâ€”both variants meet the general spec.

title: Disqualifying Thought During Critical Procedure
vignette: While approving a batch, the lead inspector day-dreams about shipping it a week past the legal deadline. Does that invalid mental note void the approval?

options.text: His improper thought disqualifies the offering.
Thoughts alone cannot invalidate an otherwise proper act.

title: Minor blemish in the senior professional
vignette: A senior professional notices a small wart on his hand before officiating.

options.text: He must step aside until blemish-free.
Such a tiny blemish can be ignored for the service.

title: Task Performed After Curfew
vignette: The quality-control cut-off is 6 p.m. but a worker performs the key measurement at 7 p.m.

options.text: Disqualify; offerings must be by day.
Proceed since most steps will occur by daybreak.

title: Lost Original vs. Replacement Part Returns
vignette: A calibrated sensor is lost, so a duplicate is installed. Days later the original is found intact.

options.text: Invalid and punishable; offerings belong in the central complex.
Accept it due to his ignorance.

title: Doubtful blood application spot
vignette: The senior professional is unsure if he sprinkled the blood on the correct main platform corner.

options.text: Repeat the application to remove doubt.
Rely on the initial act and continue.

title: Lost designated animal found later
vignette: After dedicating a bull, it wanders off. Another is offered in its place, then the original returns.

options.text: Both must now be sacrificed.
Only the replacement counts; release the first.

title: Extra Vow During Peak Season
vignette: A donor pledges an additional charitable grant right at year-end when staff are backlogged.

options.text: Postpone processing until staffing eases.
Bring it immediately to fulfill the vow without delay.

title: Substitution after animal lost
vignette: He substitutes another animal for a consecrated one that went missing, then the first is found alive.

options.text: Both are holy and must be offered.
Only one should be used; the other is redeemed.

title: Lapsed Burn Deadline for Confidential Files
vignette: Confidential papers scheduled for secure shredding are accidentally left overnight.

options.text: Burn them at once though the time passed.
Dispose discreetly and bring new portions.

title: Defective Unit Detected Pre-Use
vignette: A laptop allocated for a conference develops a faulty hinge before hand-off.

options.text: Redeem it and bring a sound one instead.
Offer it anyway to avoid delay.

title: Missing vessel for ritual
vignette: The special pan for certain offerings is misplaced.

options.text: Wait until the proper vessel is found or replaced.
Use a regular pot so the service proceeds.

title: Contaminated Container During Lab Test
vignette: Mid-experiment the technician discovers the sample cup was contaminated.

options.text: Discard the blood and slaughter anew.
Rinse the bowl quickly and continue with the same blood.

title: Mechanical device restraining animals
vignette: A new harness speeds handling of offerings but seems irreverent.

options.text: Avoid using gadgets; restrain by hand.
Use it to improve safety and efficiency.

title: Non-member Requests Access to Secure Facility
vignette: A visiting academic politely asks to use the organisation's restricted-access lab for an experiment.

options.text: Allow the test as a goodwill gesture.
Restrict offerings to covenant members only.
